ResponsesInList.Title: [Moodle 3.5] 'Not Allowed Words' error in SQL report, but not in phpmyadmin
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there! I've built the below SQL report via my localhost Moodle installation's phpmyadmin ( MariaDB 10.4.8), which runs perfectly. However, this query encounters the 'not allowed words' error when attempting to save it in the Configurable Reports plug-in as the SQL reserved word 'update' is used within the two concatenated strings. How can I run this query through the Configurable Reports plug-in? I tried escaping update using backticks (ie '.../php?`update`=') like I would if the reserved word was a column name, but this doesn't fix the issue. Here's the query: -- displays all references to lynda in the choice options table and hyperlinks them to their Moodle edit page. select concat('',cm.id,''), concat('',trim(cho.text),''), 'Choice Options' from mdl_choice_options cho join mdl_course_modules cm on cm.instance = cho.choiceid and cm.module = 5 join mdl_choice ch on cho.choiceid = ch.id where cho.text like '%lynda%' I've uploaded a screenshot of the report in the Configurable Reports plug-in and phpmyadmin. Any help is much appreciated!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [Moodle 3.5] 'Not Allowed Words' error in SQL report, but not in phpmyadmin
Re: [Moodle 3.5] 'Not Allowed Words' error in SQL report, but not in phpmyadmin
ResponsesInList.Text: Ah, that does make sense, as the plug-in does prevent users from sending any SQL commands that can edit data in the database . Thanks for posting the code for it too! Randy's solution seems like a great workaround to this.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [Moodle 3.5] 'Not Allowed Words' error in SQL report, but not in phpmyadmin
ResponsesInList.Text: As David said. My usual workaround for Config Reports is to replace one of the characters of the reserved word by its CHAR equivalent. For instance, CONCAT('updat', CHAR(101)) outputs "update" and will pass the validator. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [Moodle 3.5] 'Not Allowed Words' error in SQL report, but not in phpmyadmin
ResponsesInList.Text:
Nice! Will definitely use this here. Thanks for sharing! Putting my security hat on for a sec, I wonder if this method allow users to bypass the plug-in preventing updates to the database in this way? E.g. 
```text
concat(dro, char(112)) database moodle;
```
 I'm no SQL extraordinaire, so I don't even know if this is valid SQL.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [Moodle 3.5] 'Not Allowed Words' error in SQL report, but not in phpmyadmin
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, I don't think so, because it won't let you do anything that isn't in a SELECT statement from a specific table. If you put this there, it will just output the text with the substitutions. And it will toss an error with the semicolon too. Also, of course, since you are connecting to the db as the Moodle user, it probably has privilege to drop tables but not to drop the database (unless someone did something crazy like use mysql root). But as with any code, someone might find a sneaky way around it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [Moodle 3.5] 'Not Allowed Words' error in SQL report, but not in phpmyadmin
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Randy, Is it really necessary to use the CHAR equivalent? Can't you just use CONCAT('up', 'date') ? Séverin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: [Moodle 3.5] 'Not Allowed Words' error in SQL report, but not in phpmyadmin
ResponsesInList.Text: Séverin, Yes, I am sure that would work. I guess I usually use CHAR simply because I sometimes need it in Ad-hoc for the various punctuation marks like : and ? I need to replace and it is a matter of habit. Plus, of course, knowledge of ASCII codes is one of retro those skills I like to keep alive Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re:  New Content Monthly Report Sql Query
ResponsesInList.Text: You may be able to get some of the information you want out of the Logs report if you filter by "Created" action event types, though its probably not exactly what you're looking for and I don't think the date filter is very flexible. Report is located under Site Admin -> Reports -> Logs and then filter actions to created. If that doesn't work, I think you'll need to build this custom and whether that is in PHP as a new plugin or SQL for configurable reports, it will be pretty complex. I'm not aware of any report that already exists for this purpose.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Long time for sql-report
ResponsesInList.Text: I don't have the data you're working with, so I can't say for sure that this will help you, but it seems inefficient as is. INNER JOIN prefix_groups_members ON u.id = prefix_groups_members.userid should become INNER JOIN prefix_groups groups ON groups.courseid = c.id INNER JOIN prefix_groups_members ON groups.id = prefix_groups_members.groupid AND u.id = prefix_groups_members.userid If you want the group to be optional (for example, show a user's data even if they aren't in a group) then do this instead: LEFT JOIN prefix_groups groups ON groups.courseid = c.id

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: prefix
ResponsesInList.Text:
Rolf, This should work normally for CR. Just leave the query code with prefix_ as usual. If there is no prefix on the tables then the config.php setting should say something like $CFG->prefix = ''; and so the variable in the code for this should basically be empty. The code for this in CR which handles the prefix_ in the query and replaces it with the actual one on the site is: 
```text
$
sql
 = preg_replace('/\bprefix_(?=\w+)/i', $CFG->prefix, $
sql
);
```
 So, it replaces prefix_ with what the prefix setting has. If your Moodle instance is working with an empty prefix already, then CR should work too.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: COURSE DEDICATION TIME
ResponsesInList.Text: Mark, The code in the Configurable Reports block is based on that from the Course dedication block https://moodle.org/plugins/block_dedication and so uses the same methods of calculating. ResponsesInList.Title: Courses without grades in the gradebook
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello there, I was wondering if someone could help me with a Report; if it isn't possible I understand. The idea is to have a list of Courses that don't have any grades in the Gradebook. {The real information I need is Courses that don't have the Totals of a single or specific Columns [all Courses have the same exact Gradebook structure; so I believe the column (grade item or grade category) "Name" may work as a reference point]. However that might be too complex to do, I'm not sure.} Regards.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Courses without grades in the gradebook
ResponsesInList.Text:
This is a case for a RIGHT JOIN: 
```text
SELECT gi.courseid, c.shortname
FROM prefix_grade_items gi
RIGHT JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id = gi.courseid
```
 will show you all the courses and all the grade items, including courses that have none. Add this WHERE clause at the end to only show those without any grades at all. You can test this by creating a new course with nothing in it. 
```text
WHERE gi.courseid IS NULL
```
 Hope this starts you out with what you need to do, which may be different depending on the grade category structures, whether they are missing entirely (ie are NULLs) or have entries with zeros or blank spaces; you can never tell how it was coded until you take a look at it. In the above for grade items we are checking for something that does not exist at all, as there is no row for it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Members of multiple Groups in query
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I have the following SQL code that draws information from three tables: Users, Cohorts and Cohort Members SELECT prefix_cohort.`name`, prefix_user.firstname FROM prefix_cohort_members JOIN prefix_cohort ON prefix_cohort_members.cohortid = prefix_cohort.id JOIN prefix_user ON prefix_cohort_members.userid = prefix_user.id However, a single member can belong to several Cohorts according to "Cohort Members" table. Therefore the result duplicates each member the amount of times it repeats on a group. How could I display only one unique User per row, but showing One group it belongs to, according to a word that Group name contains? Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Members of multiple Groups in query
ResponsesInList.Text:
How about: 
```text
SELECT * FROM (


    SELECT


        profix_user.firstname + ' ' + profix_user.lastname AS studentname,


        profix_cohort.name AS cohort


    FROM


        profix_cohort_members


    JOIN profix_cohort ON profix_cohort_members.cohortid = profix_cohort.id


    JOIN profix_user ON profix_cohort_members.userid = profix_user.id


) SOURCE


PIVOT (


    COUNT(cohort)
```

```text
studentname        your_cohort_1    your_cohort_2    your_cohort_3


-------------------------------------------------------------------

Abel Drey          0                1                0


Jon Els            1                1                0


Wynand Smit        0                0                1
```
 The horrible thing is that you have to know how many cohorts you have and hardcode them in the FOR loop... But, it's a start!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL : Activity completion AND custom profile fields for a specific course
ResponsesInList.Text:
Salomé The usual solution is the add a WHERE clause to the end to limit to a specific course. If you search the contributed reports page https://docs.moodle.org/35/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports you will see many examples that look like this: 
```text
WHERE c.id=16
```
 which means restrict the results to the course with id number 16. You can also use the course shortname or fullname here too, but since the course id never changes, it is the most reliable way.  Some examples there use a placeholder like 
```text
WHERE c.id=##
```
 which means the query is made for you to put in the course id for the course you want on your site. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Summary of Feedback
ResponsesInList.Text:
I have about five different feedback activity inside a course, all the five feedback activities have the same set of questions. Q1. Are you happy with the lecture video? Yes/No Q2. Did you understand the concept? Yes/No What I am trying to is to get a cumulative summary of all the five feedback activities of all the students. I tried this query this query with out much luck 
```text
SELECT crs.fullname as "Course name", f.name AS "Journal name", CONCAT(u.firstname,' ',UPPER(u.lastname)) as "Participant", /* include these fields if you want to check the composition of the recordset */


DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(c.timemodified),'%W %e %M, %Y') AS "Answer Date",


CASE i.typ WHEN 'label' THEN i.presentation ELSE i.name END AS "Topic",  /* usually labels are used as section titles, so you'd want them present in the recordset */


v.value AS "My Answer"


 


FROM prefix_feedback AS f


INNER JOIN prefix_course AS crs ON crs.id=f.course %%FILTER_COURSES:f.course%% 


INNER JOIN prefix_feedback_item AS i ON f.id=i.feedback


INNER JOIN prefix_feedback_completed AS c ON f.id=c.feedback %%FILTER_COURSEUSER:c.userid%% 


LEFT JOIN prefix_feedback_value AS v ON v.completed=c.id AND v.item=i.id


INNER JOIN prefix_user AS u ON c.userid=u.id
```
 Please help me out.

ResponsesInList.Title: URGENT HELP NEEDED CONFIGURABLE REPORTS
ResponsesInList.Text: Forum Members, a very good morning to you, My colleague and I are working in Moodle v3.5 soon to be v3.6. We have to create multiple courses and digital content ahead of the NHS Patient Electronic Health Record software deployment project; which is scheduled for delivery in autumn of this year going live.   The impacted audience size is a little over 7,000 staff members across multiple hospitals sites in the UK Kent region, and the training team is tasked with delivering the training strategy and all subsequent reporting. We have created 10 courses, where each course has a module of eLearning in SCORM 1.2, a Confidence Report Choice Activity (Pre and Post Course), PDF Activities and other references materials, including processes and workflow maps which define patient pathways and treatment plans as links to reference materials. The problem we are experiencing is, when running reports, our exported data is not giving us all of the information we so desperately need.    We can produce multiple reports that have the data which, is stored in different parts of the LMS database and we have made arrangements so that we can connect our Excel App to the ODBC LMS Databases on the server directly.  However, when connecting to the database and having access to all of the tables, we struggle to source the information and data we need, to create the desired report. Therefore, we are calling upon the good will of the Moodle community and those who wish to receive and take credit for helping us in our plight, to assist us in creating a Single SQL report which collates the data from all courses and user profiles in addition to data from the Category, Course and Learner reports.    If it pulled just one record we could figure the rest out for ourselves but we really are struggling as none of us are SQL coders. Your reward for helping us, would be recognition both locally and nationally across the UK NHS Trust community via all social media outlets promoting your professional services, helping you to generate future business. I know this is somewhat of an unorthodox request but we have exhausted all avenues available to us and only have until the 16th April to get the matter resolved before it starts to impact the projects delivery data as all Ward Managers and Team Leaders are going to need this reporting to track and follow their staff progress. My sincerest thanks in advance for any contribution you can make. Mark Jones T3 Training & Development Specialists NHS East Kent Hospitals University Foundation Trust. +44 (0) 7851 74 43 11 +44 (0) 1227 20 66 53 mark.jones39@nhs.net

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: hits, student hits and teacher hits shows zero
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Abu, It would be very useful to point to where you found this query, so that one can perhaps update it for the benefit of everybody. You didn't wrote which Moodle version you use, and which logging method? mdl_log is the old (legacy) logging table, and Moodle 2.7 introduced mdl_logstore_standard_log as new (standard) logging table. When using mdl_logstore_standard_log (replacing mdl_log), you must modify the
query, to replace (only for this table) : mdl_log by mdl_logstore_standard_log course by
courseid time by timecreated HTH , Séverin

Which leads me to believe it would require some SQL knowledge to extract this information, and unfortunately I'm not a SQL person. Any ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Seeing all feedback from one student
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, it turns out I could google enough SQL knowledge to figure it out. My final custom query was this: SELECT prefix_user.firstname, prefix_user.lastname, prefix_feedback.name as module, prefix_feedback_item.name as question, prefix_feedback_value.value as response FROM prefix_feedback_value INNER JOIN prefix_feedback_completed ON prefix_feedback_completed.id = prefix_feedback_value.completed INNER JOIN prefix_user ON prefix_feedback_completed.userid = prefix_user.id INNER JOIN prefix_feedback ON prefix_feedback_completed.feedback = prefix_feedback.id INNER JOIN prefix_feedback_item ON prefix_feedback_value.item = prefix_feedback_item.id WHERE prefix_feedback_completed.userid = 44 ORDER BY question If I don't include the "WHERE prefix_feedback_completed.userid = 44" to select just the user I want, I of course get all users' feedback. But the "filter" functionality of the Custom Reports doesn't seem to work successfully to restrict something to the same userid-based filtration. Not sure if that's a known problem or not.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Seeing all feedback from one student
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for sharing!  In order to get the filter to work, you need to add a line of code to the report. %%FILTER_USERS:prefix_user.id%%  should do it but you might need to play with that a little.  Normally rename the table reference so not totally sure if you need prefix_ or not.

ResponsesInList.Title: Proper Case in Column Titles for SQL reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the updated version of this plugin.  It fixed my previously reported start/end filter issue. I have a question about the titles at the top of columns in an SQL report.  I'd like to have the first letter of each word in the title be uppercase, i.e., proper case.  Column titles display as proper case in "Users reports" but they're lowercase in "SQL reports". Does anyone know how to modify the SQL queries below to get proper case for the column titles in an SQL report? SELECT u.firstname AS 'First Name', u.lastname) AS 'Last Name', u.email AS 'Email', Thanks much for any suggestions! David

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Report for Moodle up to 3.5
ResponsesInList.Text: Parts of Configurable Reports are compatible with Moodle 3.2, 3.3, 3,4 and 3.5 however there are definitely issues. For example, you can create custom SQL reports but can't import existing reports . Creating graphs doesn't work . Icons are broken and links to stylesheets are broken. I fixed some of these issues in my fork at https://github.com/michael-milette/moodle-block_configurablereports/tree/MOODLE_33_STABLE which at least makes it usable in Moodle 3.2, 3.3, 3.4 and 3.5. If anyone has fixes for remaining issues listed above in bold, please share them on the GitHub fork so that we can all get this very useful plugin back into a working state. Keep in mind that I am just looking to fix existing bugs/issues, not make enhancements the plugin. Hopefully, one of these days, the fixes will be pulled into the official configurable Reports. Hope you find this useful. Best regards, Michael Milette

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable Report for Moodle up to 3.5
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Michael, Thanks to share your work on the configurable reports bloc, to allow easier use with recent Moodle versions. I also really hope fixes will be integrated officially. Sorry not to have solution for remaining problems, and hope someone else will provide useful information for that. Best regards, Séverin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable Report for Moodle up to 3.5
ResponsesInList.Text: Michael, please enable the Issue Tracker on your GitHub fork so we can report issues with your fork. (Unless you're using the Moodle Tracker . If so please post details). Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable Report for Moodle up to 3.5
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Luis, I am just implementing bug fixes that I and others create. To ensure that the issues and pull requests get addressed in the official master release, please submit your issues to: https://github.com/jleyva/moodle-block_configurablereports/issues I go by there every once in a while to integrate submitted pull requests for bug fixes into my fork. However, I am not adding features and not doing any development beyond that unless someone pays me to do. I need to focus on my current client related projects right now. Best regards, Michael

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable Report for Moodle up to 3.5
ResponsesInList.Text: If we are talking about importing from github, then translation to version php 7.2 will help The error occurs when in is_object (in the function urldecode_recursive configurable_reports/locallib.php:174) comes objects without a class definition, it returns false in 7.2 returns true See http://php.net/manual/ru/function.is-object.php#refsect1-function.is-object-changelog

ResponsesInList.Title: Is it possible to show Activity Completion for only one Cohort?
ResponsesInList.Text: I like the Course Completion / Activity Completion view for a high level class. But I have many people enrolled in my course, but only one cohort which I expect to be done with the class by a certain deadline. Is there any way to filter the Course Completion view so it only shows a single cohort (not all, or people based on their first/last names?)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to show Activity Completion for only one Cohort?
ResponsesInList.Text: In configurable reports or in the regular activity completion report?  I believe you can filter by group and you can automatically create groups from cohorts...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to show Activity Completion for only one Cohort?
ResponsesInList.Text: It's specifically when I'm in a class and do Gear -> More -> Reports -> Course Completion. What's the other way to get to this view where you can filter by Cohort?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to show Activity Completion for only one Cohort?
ResponsesInList.Text: Just bumping this thread again since I still haven't found a way to view only the completion status of my cohort yet :/

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to show Activity Completion for only one Cohort?
ResponsesInList.Text: Emma gave you the answer--create groups based on your cohorts in the course .  In your cohort enrollment, add that group.  Don't forget to enable groups (separate or visible--I typically use separate, but I use them for me, not for participants...it probably doesn't matter a lot for this) for your course.  Then when you look at the course/activity completion reports, ask to see just that group. If you have a bunch of courses you need this in, you could create a bulk upload for group creation (not population) and that makes the group creation super fast (I used to have 12 groups I used and I just dropped in the group upload when I first created the course, if I wasn't copying it--it takes about 15 seconds once you have your file created).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Is it possible to show Activity Completion for only one Cohort?
ResponsesInList.Text: OK, I haven't used groups before. But that seemed to do the trick (even though it's super unintuitive how to make groups from cohorts and it took like 5 tries :/) Thank you Melanie!

ResponsesInList.Title: How to use Multiple custom fields in a report
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Please help me with the configurable report. I have taken 3 custom user fields. ROLE, REGION, CLINIC And I want to use this into the configurable report. But it's not working I have used %%FILTER_USERS:uinfo.data%% It is working when I use filter only one user fields. but when I want record with Particular Role and Region Or Clinic then it's not working.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to use Multiple custom fields in a report
ResponsesInList.Text: Is it just the filter that is not working?  Have you added a filter for each custom field? e.g. %%FILTER_USERS:uinfo2.data%% and %%FILTER_USERS:uinfo3.data%%

ResponsesInList.Title: Not Familiar With Git Hub - need plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: I know, I know. Sorry but I'm feeling my way here. I upgraded to M3.4 and need to upgrade the config reports plugin. I'm not that familiar with git hub and I'm looking for a plugin file I can install. Would one of you experts please show me the way? Thanks in advance!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Not Familiar With Git Hub - need plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: There isn't a version of Configurable Reports that officially works with Moodle 3.4. The Configurable Reports block hasn't been upgraded since Moodle 3.1. Juan, the developer, now heads up the Moodle Mobile team at the Moodle office in Spain and it seems he doesn't have time to update the plugin... You can get the latest official version from https://moodle.org/plugins/block_configurable_reports . Download the .zip file from there and then extract it to the Moodle folder on your server . Some people say it still works - but with some issues. It depends on what functionality you are using... If you have any major problems with it, try the forks that have been released by other developers who depend on Configurable Reports but couldn't wait two years and five Moodle versions for an official release. Example: https://github.com/michael-milette/moodle-block_configurablereports . Look in the Moodle Tracker for issues relating to reporting in Moodle and you'll find issues like: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-63233 https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/MDL-62080 Read the comments in those MDL issues for interesting suggestions. If you don't want to rely on hacky fixes to unmaintained plugins then consider joining the Moodle Users Association ( MUA ) and vote for the Customizable Report Builder proposal. If you can't afford the risks of using an unsupported version of Configurable Reports and you can't wait for any unconfirmed solutions from the MUA then try the Ad-Hoc Database Queries (custom sql ) plugin from the Open University. It does roughly the same thing as Configurable Reports (lets you run your own sql queries) and has been around for a long time.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Not Familiar With Git Hub - need plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Luis Thanks for taking the time to provide such information. I will follow your suggestions! Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Not Familiar With Git Hub - need plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Before you make any changes to your production Moodle server make sure you test all changes on a copy of your Moodle site on a test server. Don't make changes to production without first testing thoroughly on a test server - especially if you're trying unofficial forks of the Configurable Reports plugin.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Not Familiar With Git Hub - need plugin
ResponsesInList.Text: Our internal policy is to make a shadow copy of sites and test all upgrades and modifications on it. So, we're covered in this regard but, thanks for the reminder Luis! Ken

ResponsesInList.Title: how to display empty values from the user_info_data table
ResponsesInList.Text: i have a scenario where i have two groups of users inside a course:, one group have attempted the quize inside the course, and therefore their quiz completion date is recorded automatically on the db, so i am able to call this value on my report. The other group; i have manually graded their grades, and i created an additional profile field called 'CompletionDate' and then manually added the values on this field. On the code below, i have a column on my report which i named 'completion date'. on this i want to display two different values, which is quiz completion date and the value stored inside the additional field 'CompletionDate'; depending on whether there is a value on either fields (quiz completion or 'CompletionDate). so this means, if the value inside the 'CompletionDate' field is empty; this means the user has attempted the quiz, thus the code should return the quiz completion date (gg.timecreated); if the there is a value inside the 'CompletionDate' field then the code should return the value stored. below is the code i'm using; somehow it returns only the users who have values stored inside the 'CompletionDate' and omits users who have attempted the quiz. is there something wrong with my code? SELECT u.username AS Code, u.firstname AS Name, u.lastname AS Surname, c.fullname AS Assessment, c.id AS 'Quiz ID', q.intro AS 'Product code', u.yahoo AS Province, u.msn AS Unit, ROUND(gg.finalgrade, 0)as grade, if(d.data != " ",d.data,FROM_UNIXTIME(gg.timecreated, '%Y-%m-%d')) as 'completion date', FROM prefix_quiz q JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id = q.course JOIN prefix_grade_items gi ON gi.iteminstance = q.id JOIN prefix_grade_grades gg ON gg.itemid = gi.id JOIN prefix_user u ON u.id = gg.userid join prefix_user_info_field f left join prefix_user_info_data d on f.id = d.fieldid and f.shortname = 'CompletionDate' WHERE (c.id = 1372) and (d.fieldid = f.id AND d.userid=u.id) AND gg.finalgrade !=" " Group By gg.id

ResponsesInList.Title: Configurable Reports does not work since update
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello together, we experience a problem with our configurable reports SQL Code since we updated our system to 3.4. Can anybody help us with following code snippet? SELECT u.firstname AS 'First Name' , u.lastname AS 'Last Name' , CONCAT('','Link','') AS 'Links to Activity Report' # ,  COUNT(l.id) AS 'Edits' , SUM(IF(FLOOR((l.TIME - c.startdate)/(60*60*24*7))=1,1,0)) AS 'Unit 0 Post' #, CONCAT('','Logs','') AS 'Logs' #, CONCAT('','Outline','') AS 'Activity Outline' #, CONCAT('','Activity','') AS 'Consolidated Activity' FROM prefix_user AS u JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON ra.contextid = ctx.id JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_course_categories AS cc ON c.category = cc.id LEFT JOIN prefix_log AS l ON l.userid = u.id AND l.course = c.id  AND l.action LIKE "%add%" WHERE c.id = %%COURSEID%% AND ra.roleid =5 AND ctx.instanceid = c.id GROUP BY u.id ORDER BY u.lastname, u.firstname Thank you in advance. Kind Regards Wolf Georg Tews

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable Reports does not work since update
ResponsesInList.Text: What is the error you're getting? If you just created that report, you'll need to check the box to make it a "Global Report" in the report settings for the '%%COURSEID%%' filter to work. -Ben

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable Reports does not work since update
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Ben, thank you for your answer - apparently, the plugin does not count correctly. I inserted some more weeks in the code. In unit 3 in the first row should stay 7 instead of 2. It should only count the posts created in the specific week. Thank you in advance and have a great weekend. Best Georg

ResponsesInList.Title: Adding Responses from Adobe Captivate SCORM Interactions Report
ResponsesInList.Text: We have created an Online Training using Adobe Captivate, and there are a bunch of long answer questions that I would like reported into a Configurable Report and so far I've had 0 luck in figuring out how to do so. I'm sure this could be done using a custom SQL approach, however, I'm not sure how to do this. Such as what do I need to access in order to report on the SCORM variables? You can access these directly if you enter the SCORM course / REPORTS / Interactions Report, however, I want to add these into a custom report that I can allow users of specific permissions to access. I'm looking for a report that basically includes: FIRSTNAME | LASTNAME |SCORM COMPLETION | INTERACTION RESPONSE Is this possible?

ResponsesInList.Title: Error console reports missing CSS files
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello, I am using Configurable Reports 3.1.1 on a site running Moodle 3.2.2+ (Build: 20170324) with the Adaptable Theme active. The error console reports the following errors (same message x 3): 
```text
Failed to load resource: the 
server
 responded with a status of 404 (not found)
```
 The faulty links appear to be: 
```text
http://mymoodle.mysite.com/theme/styles.php/adaptable/blocks/configurable_reports/js/datatables/media/css/jquery.dataTables.css


http://mymoodle.mysite.com/theme/styles.php/adaptable/blocks/configurable_reports/js/codemirror/addon/display/fullscreen.css


http://mymoodle.mysite.com/theme/styles.php/adaptable/blocks/configurable_reports/js/codemirror/lib/codemirror.css
```
 Looking in the page source for the included stylesheets I found this one: 
```text
<link rel="stylesheet" type="text/
css
" href="
http://mymoodle.mysite.com/theme/styles.php/adaptable/1493297224/all
" />
```
 Then I opened the "all" stylesheet in a new tab and found these import clauses: 
```text
@import url(../blocks/configurable_reports/js/datatables/media/css/jquery.dataTables.css);


@import url(../blocks/configurable_reports/js/codemirror/lib/codemirror.css);


@import url(../blocks/configurable_reports/js/codemirror/addon/display/fullscreen.css);
```
 (that is, the same faulty links in the error console, mentioned above). Further tests: uninstall and reinstall Configurable Reports: the errors persisted. change theme: I purged the theme cache, then deactivated Adaptable and activated the Clean theme: the errors persisted, only replacing the word "adaptable" with "clean". change browser: the same errors were shown in Chrome, Firefox , Opera and Safari. created the folders 
```text
http://mymoodle.mysite.com/theme/adaptable/blocks/configurable_reports/js/
```
 and loaded the missing stylesheets in the appropriate subfolders: the errors persisted. Hence I conclude it is not a browser-related issue, neither a theme-related one. My question is - how to fix the problem? I would like to see the report as it was designed by its author and then possibly customize it to the look and feel of the entire site. Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable reports for Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan, I really appreciate everything you've done with this plugin, and understand that you're busy with the Moodle Mobile/Desktop work.  Are you able to confirm whether or not a 3.3 or 3.4 compatible version of this plugin is going to be on the radar post-deployment of Moodle 3.4, please?  If not, we (and probably others) will have to look into developing an alternative as it's become very useful to our clients over the years, and not having it (or an alternative) is going to be a barrier to upgrading. Regards, Martin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable reports for Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: I am curious on the issues that you are seeing with the plugin - I have it successfully installed and working on three separate 3.3 sites...it does throw a few errors in Full Developer debugging mode but nothing that is affecting the functioning of the site.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable reports for Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: I have yet to apply it to a 3.3 site; I am hesitant to do so until it's officially supported.  I've been slammed on here before for installing plugins on Moodle versions they are not marked as being compatible for and then highlighting issues I've encountered, so, once burned, etc. At this point, my bigger concern is whether or not the plugin is really supported any more, due to changing priorities.  If not, then we need to factor that in to any future version upgrades. Whilst it may be OK in your experience now on 3.3, that will not necessarily be the case for 3.4, 3.5 etc. and if the plugin is falling out of support, then one has to consider support implications one takes upon themselves for contracts that are being signed for two, three or even five years hence.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Configurable reports for Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, yes, the plugin is supported but I've been really busy doing all the Mobile stuff. I think the plugin should work fine in 3.2, 3.3 and 3.4 but it will need an overall review before indicating that those versions are supported. I'll try to do this review during next month, but I can't promise anything! Juan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: "Print report" button is not working on IE and Chrome
ResponsesInList.Text: I was able to fix this by tweaking the printDiv function in locallib.php to function printDiv(id){ var cdiv, tmpw; cdiv = document.getElementById(id); tmpw = window.open(" ","Print"); tmpw.document.open(); tmpw.document.write('<html><body></body></html>'); tmpw.document.body.innerHTML = cdiv.innerHTML; tmpw.document.close(); tmpw.print(); tmpw.close(); }

ResponsesInList.Title: Site-wide completion report that includes meta-course enrolments
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all.  I'm using meta course enrolments for many courses and I want to report on these.  The very excellent progress report from the ad-hoc contributed reports does a great job of showing progress in all courses by user, but if that user is enrolled in a course via a meta course, they are not included in the report. I've spent some time playing with the report and trying to work out why it only shows manual enrolments, but I have to admit defeat.  I'm just not familiar enough with the Moodle schema to work it out. I'm hoping someone can look at the query and pinpoint where it excludes meta-course enrolments.  If that can be done then hopefully a tiny change to the report will be all that is needed. Very appreciative of any help on this. Thanks Paul ---- SELECT u.firstname AS 'First Name' , u.lastname AS 'Last Name' , c.fullname AS 'Course' , FROM_UNIXTIME(ue.timecreated, '%m/%d/%Y') AS 'Enrolled' , IFNULL((SELECT DATE_FORMAT(MIN(FROM_UNIXTIME(log.time)),'%m/%d/%Y') FROM prefix_log log WHERE log.course=c.id AND log.userid=u.id), 'Never') AS 'First Access' , (SELECT IF(ue.status=0, ' ', 'Withdrawn')) AS 'Withdrawn' , IFNULL((SELECT DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(la.timeaccess), '%m/%d/%Y') FROM prefix_user_lastaccess la WHERE la.userid=u.id AND la.courseid=c.id),'Never') AS 'Last Access', /*A count of the number of distinct days a student has entered a course*/ IFNULL((SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT FROM_UNIXTIME(log.time, '%m/%d/%Y')) FROM prefix_log log WHERE log.course=c.id AND log.userid=u.id AND log.action='view' AND log.module='course' GROUP BY u.id ),'0') AS '# Days Accessed', IFNULL((SELECT COUNT(gg.finalgrade) FROM prefix_grade_grades AS gg JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gg.itemid=gi.id WHERE gi.courseid=c.id AND gg.userid=u.id AND gi.itemtype='mod' GROUP BY u.id,c.id),'0') AS ' Activities Completed' , IFNULL((SELECT COUNT(gi.itemname) FROM prefix_grade_items AS gi WHERE gi.courseid = c.id AND gi.itemtype='mod'), '0') AS 'Activities Assigned' , /*If Activities completed = activities assigned, show date of last log entry. Otherwise, show percentage complete. If Activities Assigned = 0, show 'n/a'.--*/ (SELECT IF(`Activities Assigned`!='0', (SELECT IF((`Activities Completed`)=(`Activities Assigned`), /*--Last log entry--*/ (SELECT CONCAT('100% completed ',FROM_UNIXTIME(MAX(log.time),'%m/%d/%Y')) FROM prefix_log log WHERE log.course=c.id AND log.userid=u.id), /*--Percent completed--*/ (SELECT CONCAT(IFNULL(ROUND((`Activities Completed`)/(`Activities Assigned`)*100,0), '0'),'% complete')))), 'n/a')) AS '% of Course Completed' , IFNULL(CONCAT(ROUND((SELECT (IFNULL((SELECT SUM(gg.finalgrade) FROM prefix_grade_grades AS gg JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gi.id=gg.itemid WHERE gg.itemid=gi.id AND gi.courseid=c.id AND gi.itemtype='mod' AND gg.userid=u.id GROUP BY u.id,c.id),0)/(SELECT SUM(gi.grademax) FROM prefix_grade_items AS gi JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gi.id=gg.itemid WHERE gg.itemid=gi.id AND gi.courseid=c.id AND gi.itemtype='mod' AND gg.userid=u.id AND gg.finalgrade IS NOT NULL GROUP BY u.id,c.id))*100),0),'%'),'n/a') AS 'Quality of Work to Date', (SELECT IF(`Activities Assigned`!='0',CONCAT(IFNULL(ROUND(((SELECT gg.finalgrade/gi.grademax FROM prefix_grade_items AS gi JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.itemid=gi.id WHERE gi.courseid=c.id AND gg.userid=u.id AND gi.itemtype='course' GROUP BY 'gi.courseid')*100),0),'0'),'%'),'n/a')) AS 'Final Score (incl xtra credit)' FROM prefix_user u JOIN prefix_user_enrolments ue ON ue.userid=u.id JOIN prefix_enrol e ON e.id=ue.enrolid JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id = e.courseid JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON ctx.instanceid = c.id JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id JOIN prefix_role AS r ON r.id = e.roleid WHERE ra.userid=u.id AND ctx.instanceid=c.id /*AND ue.status='0'*/ ### "0" FOR active, "1" FOR suspended. Leave commented OUT TO include BOTH. AND ra.roleid='5' ### "5" = student AND c.visible='1' ### "1" FOR course visible, "0" FOR hidden GROUP BY u.id, c.id ORDER BY u.lastname, u.firstname, c.fullname

ResponsesInList.Title: SQL for handling Radio Btns
ResponsesInList.Text: I figured out how to handle the problem with the reports only having numeric value from the radio button instead of the value on the feedback report. SELECT i.name AS Questions, CASE /*Determines if the type of answer is a radio button */ WHEN i.typ = 'multichoice' THEN CASE /*Grabs the value from the radio button and combines it with the presentation part of the radio button */ WHEN v.value = 1 THEN SUBSTRING_INDEX(IF (SUBSTRING(i.presentation,1,6)='r>>>>>', SUBSTRING(i.presentation,7), i.presentation), '|', 1) WHEN v.value = 2 THEN SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(i.presentation,'|',2), '|', -1) WHEN v.value = 3 THEN SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(i.presentation,'|',3), '|', -1) WHEN v.value = 4 THEN SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(i.presentation,'|',4), '|', -1) WHEN v.value = 5 THEN SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(i.presentation,'|',5), '|', -1) WHEN v.value = 6 THEN SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(i.presentation,'|',6), '|', -1) WHEN v.value = 7 THEN SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(i.presentation,'|',7), '|', -1) WHEN v.value = 8 THEN SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(i.presentation,'|',8), '|', -1) END ELSE v.value     /* this states that if it's not a multichoice answer then just give the answer that's in the input field*/ END AS "Answers", u.username AS 'User', c.shortname AS 'Course', DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(fc.timemodified),'%Y-%m-%d') AS "Completed" FROM prefix_feedback f JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id=f.course JOIN prefix_feedback_item AS i ON f.id=i.feedback JOIN prefix_feedback_completed fc ON f.id=fc.feedback LEFT JOIN prefix_feedback_value v ON v.completed=fc.id AND v.item=i.id LEFT JOIN prefix_user AS u ON fc.userid=u.id WHERE v.value != 'pagebreak'

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: User’s details in the Header section
ResponsesInList.Text:
I use a CONCAT statement to combine info then use UNION to join that header row to the rest of the query. e.g. SELECT CONCAT(usub.lastname,", ",usub.firstname,  "  ||  Last login was ",  (IF (usub.lastaccess = 0,"never",DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(usub.lastaccess),'%Y-%m-%d'))),  "  ||  [Student# ", usub.idnumber,  "] " ) AS 'assessment_title' FROM prefix_user AS usub WHERE usub.id - %%USERID%% -- shows details only for currently logged in student UNION SELECT (insert query to give list of courses for this student) WHERE usub.id - %%USERID%% -- shows details only for currently logged in student 

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sort lastaccess by date
ResponsesInList.Text:
Here's a report I use for course completion... ```text SELECT   CONCAT('', u.firstname ,'')     AS 'First Name',   CONCAT('', u.lastname ,'')     AS 'Surname',   CONCAT('', c.fullname ,'')     AS 'Course',   DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME   (p.timecompleted),'%Y%m%d
%D %M %Y') ``` On the time completed date, you will see TWO date entries ```text '%Y%m%d
%D %M %Y' ``` The first generates the date as yyyymmdd, eg, 20180123, the second is a more friendly readable date, eg, 23rd January 2018. This allows the column to be sorted in date ascending or descending order.

ResponsesInList.Title: Add group name to Badge Report
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi everybody. I´m new in this sql world so hope to get help. In the next code, how could I add in the report the name of the group? Made several attempts but no way. (tried: c.fullname; g.name, etc). Thanks!! SELECT u.firstname, u.lastname, b.courseid, b.name AS badgename, CASE WHEN b.courseid IS NOT NULL THEN (SELECT c.shortname FROM prefix_course AS c WHERE c.id = b.courseid) WHEN b.courseid IS NULL THEN "*" END AS Context , CASE WHEN t.criteriatype = 1 AND t.method = 1 THEN "Activity Completion (All)" WHEN t.criteriatype = 1 AND t.method = 2 THEN "Activity Completion (Any)" WHEN t.criteriatype = 2 AND t.method = 2 THEN "Manual Award" WHEN t.criteriatype = 4 AND t.method = 1 THEN "Course Completion (All)" WHEN t.criteriatype = 4 AND t.method = 2 THEN "Course Completion (Any)" ELSE CONCAT ('Other: ', t.criteriatype) END AS Criteriatype, DATE_FORMAT( FROM_UNIXTIME( d.dateissued ) , '%Y-%m-%d' ) AS dateissued, CONCAT ('link') AS Details FROM prefix_badge_issued AS d JOIN prefix_badge AS b ON d.badgeid = b.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON d.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_badge_criteria AS t ON b.id = t.badgeid WHERE t.criteriatype <> 0 ORDER BY u.username

ResponsesInList.Title: How to include custom user profile field in SQL?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, I am new to Moodle and inexperienced in SQL . I found this SQL which works fine, instead, I would like to change the 'city' column to a custom user profile which I have created called: jobtitle. _______________________________________________________ SELECT user2.firstname AS Firstname, user2.lastname AS Lastname, user2.email AS Email, user2.city AS City, course.fullname AS Course ,(SELECT shortname FROM prefix_role WHERE id=en.roleid) AS ROLE ,(SELECT name FROM prefix_role WHERE id=en.roleid) AS RoleName FROM prefix_course AS course JOIN prefix_enrol AS en ON en.courseid = course.id JOIN prefix_user_enrolments AS ue ON ue.enrolid = en.id JOIN prefix_user AS user2 ON ue.userid = user2.id _____________________________________________________________________________ I have tried to change the line: user2.city AS City, to: user2.profile_field _jobtitle AS Jobtitle But that didn't work. Thank you very much for your help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to include custom user profile field in SQL?
ResponsesInList.Text: You need to look through the database to find where custom fields are stored.  Custom profile fields are not stored in the moodle user table.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to include custom user profile field in SQL?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Marinda, If your Moodle site is running on MySQL , you can achieve this by adding a sub query to your SELECT clause. For example: 
```text
SELECT firstname,


       lastname,


       (SELECT UID.data FROM prefix_user_info_field UIF, prefix_user_info_data UID WHERE UID.fieldid = UIF.id AND UIF.shortname = '
jobtitle
' AND UID.userid = U.id) as '
jobtitle
'


FROM prefix_user U
```
 This query assumes the Profile Field's shortname is "jobtitle". Your query can be successfully updated as follows: 
```text
SELECT
user2.firstname AS Firstname,
user2.lastname AS Lastname,
user2.email AS Email,
user2.city AS City,
(SELECT UID.data FROM prefix_user_info_field UIF, prefix_user_info_data UID WHERE UID.fieldid = UIF.id AND UIF.shortname = 'jobtitle' AND UID.userid = user2.id) as 'jobtitle',
course.fullname AS Course
,(SELECT shortname FROM prefix_role WHERE id=en.roleid) AS ROLE
,(SELECT name FROM prefix_role WHERE id=en.roleid) AS RoleName
FROM prefix_course AS course 
JOIN prefix_enrol AS en ON en.courseid = course.id
JOIN prefix_user_enrolments AS ue ON ue.enrolid = en.id
JOIN prefix_user AS user2 ON ue.userid = user2.id
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to include custom user profile field in SQL?
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you very much Tim!!! It works like a charm! Much appreciated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Enroll Date is sometimes December 31, 1969
ResponsesInList.Text: I am running a query on all courses to see who is enrolled in the courses and when they enrolled. We are using Moodle release: 3.1.6. When I run the query, some of the students enrollment date is 1969-12-31 19:00:00. The rest are what they should be. I created a test course and manually enrolled 8 from our staff. 6 had the correct date and two had 1969-12-31 19:00:00. I am not sure why this would be. I assume 1969-12-31 19:00:00 is "beginning date" for Moodle. This occurs for most courses. Below I show the test course as an example. I see it whenever the date should be 0 or a null, like a completion date when a course is not completed yet. Here is my query which is working: SELECT {course_completions}.id AS Q3e_record_id, {user}.LASTNAME, {course_completions}.userid AS Q3e_user_ID, {course_completions}.course AS Q3e_course_ID, {course}.fullname AS Course_Name, {course_completions}.timeenrolled AS date_user_enrolled_Q3e FROM {course_completions} JOIN {user} ON {user}.ID = {course_completions}.userid JOIN {course} ON {course}.ID = {course_completions}.course WHERE course = 157 ORDER BY {course_completions}.timeenrolled, {course}.fullname Here is the result: Any ideas as to why this happens is appreciated. I am hoping to pull this into a tracking report.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enroll Date is sometimes December 31, 1969
ResponsesInList.Text: January 1, 1970 00:00 UTC is the start of the Unix epoch for time. All times are stored internally in Unix time which is the number of seconds elapsed from the epoch start. So, 0 or NULL corresponds to 0 seconds of the Epoch. When you format the Unix time number and see the Dec 31 dates, that is due to an offset for the timezone on the server , so your 19:00 tells you the timezone offset is 5 hours before UTC time of the epoch start.

I manually enrolled all of the students. Confused as to why Moodle registered the actual day and time I enrolled 6 of the students but not Hopkins and Sherwood. Any ideas? Also, as an Admin, can I easily edit the dates?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enroll Date is sometimes December 31, 1969
ResponsesInList.Text: That's a good question. Looking at some sample data, I see that when a user is complete, i.e. a time is set in course_completion.timecompleted, then the course_completion.timeenrolled is also set to 0. So, if you add the timecompleted column to your query that correlation should show up. That may explain the data in your query, since it is showing only timeenrolled. But, also, I see other instances where this is not so and all three completed times, enrolled, started, completed are filled in. I am not sure why.  There is a complex relation of the user enrollment times and the course completion times and I don't understand it completely yet. Cron is part of the equation, for sure though. And there is clearly at least one condition under which the timeenrolled is not set to 0 when the user completion time is  stamped.

The 4 students listed with 1969 as the start date were only manually enrolled by me and did not do any activities . So I would have expected these times to be blank. Since this was a controlled test course, I actually had only one of the students fulfill the course requirements and her completion date is posted. The others are blank. Everything but the 1969 is as I expected it to be posted. I'm definitely no expert but I think this about the timestamp at the moment something occurs is not being registered and Moodle using the EPOCH date as default. Not sure why this would happen only every once in a while.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Enroll Date is sometimes December 31, 1969
ResponsesInList.Text: That's entirely possible: when you enable course completion in a course, it runs and back fills in any waiting completions and later cron runs it. And it may also do that to newly enrolled users too who don't have any activity at all yet. It could just dump in a 0 = the epoch instead of leaving it empty. I've seen any number of instances where different processes do not agree how to handle data for similar or closely related processes, one process using nulls, another whitespace, another 0. So an inconsistency like this would be par for the course. Enrolment times and start of completion times don't match up. The code probably holds the answer, and/or it's a bug.

ResponsesInList.Title: Individual monthly logins 2.8
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm trying to find a simple way to find out how many discrete user logins we have for each month.  Does anyone have a report that does this? Example:  using logs, I can download each day's logs and remove duplicates on users to identify daily but I need the whole month.  I can download each day, compile them and then remove duplicates but that is a huge amount of work...I did it for last June.  It took a stupid long time.  And the answer was about 2000.  But June is our busiest month.  I need a baseline.  Anyone?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Individual monthly logins 2.8
ResponsesInList.Text:
Melanie, Give this a try: 
```text
SELECT 


 COUNT(DISTINCT l.userid) AS 'DistinctUserLogins', 


 DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(l.timecreated), '%M') AS 'Month'


FROM prefix_logstore_standard_log l


WHERE l.action = 'loggedin' AND YEAR(FROM_UNIXTIME(l.timecreated)) = '2017' 


GROUP BY MONTH(FROM_UNIXTIME(l.timecreated))
```
 It should show you something like the attached but with obviously bigger numbers ;)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Individual monthly logins 2.8
ResponsesInList.Text: OOOHH!  Very nice.  I haven't put the fresh sql brain in for a while and just wasn't up to it...but your sql made perfect sense.  Works great, too!  Thank you!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Individual monthly logins 2.8
ResponsesInList.Text: This is awesome. And works just fine on 3.1. Could this be modified to see logins by day of the week or logins per hour in a day? Trying to judge when traffic is heaviest and lightest.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Individual monthly logins 2.8
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, in theory, yes. The magic is in the GROUP BY statement, combined with the %M label for the month. So, any unit you could group by and also get a unit label for should work. There's a bunch of options: https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.5/en/date-and-time-functions.html . Try some out.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Individual monthly logins 2.8
ResponsesInList.Text:
Yep, here's one for all weeks of a year: 
```text
SELECT 
 COUNT(DISTINCT l.userid) AS 'DistinctUserLogins', 
 DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(l.timecreated), '%U') AS 'WeekofYear'
FROM prefix_logstore_standard_log l
WHERE l.action = 'loggedin' AND YEAR(FROM_UNIXTIME(l.timecreated)) = '2017' 
GROUP BY WEEKOFYEAR(FROM_UNIXTIME(l.timecreated))
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Timeout
ResponsesInList.Text: I tried it in Adminer too and it fails at the same place, so it is not a limit with the plugin, it must be a MySQL issue. If I recall there are some settings related to the number of selects and joins and their sizes. BIG_SELECTS is one and there's one for maximum joins too.  I would guess that here it is the number of wheres it the issue but perhaps one of those would solve the issue. A possible workaround is to recast those joins as sub-select statements instead. I think that might work better, since it might handle the memory for those subselects differently than having a large main query.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Timeout
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Randy... I'll give those a try.  I really appreciate your assistance with this!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Timeout
ResponsesInList.Text:
Chris, Casting them as subselects instead appears to work. I just did a query with 12 profile fields and it worked fine. Structure is like: 
```text
SELECT u.username

,(SELECT d1.data FROM prefix_user_info_data d1
 JOIN prefix_user_info_field f1 ON d1.fieldid = f1.id AND f1.shortname = 'favcolor'
 WHERE d1.userid = u.id
) AS thefavcolor


,(SELECT d1.data FROM prefix_user_info_data d1
 JOIN prefix_user_info_field f1 ON d1.fieldid = f1.id AND f1.shortname = 'musical'
 WHERE d1.userid = u.id
) AS themusical
```
 Repeat as needed for each profile shortname. Then 
```text
FROM prefix_user u
```
 Put as many as you want there. It reduces the WHERE and JOINS to one at a time. That should do it. Let me know if that works for you. If so, I will update that wiki page with this as an alternate code for large numbers of fields. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Timeout
ResponsesInList.Text: That did it... so awesome! Thank you sir!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Timeout
ResponsesInList.Text: Chris, I knew vaguely there was a select and join limit, but who knew it would be so low. I've never run into it with Moodle and I work on some fairly large sites. Anyway, this is a nicer way to do it I think. A bit codier but cleaner. Glad that worked out. Randy

ResponsesInList.Title: Multiple timedate filters on union query
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm trying to display 3 queries in one report via UNIONs, which works fine. The problem is that I need the timedate filter to work on all 3 queries, and right now it is only working on the first. Does anyone know how resolve this? Here is the current query: SELECT CONCAT(u.firstname, ' ', u.lastname) as 'Name', IF(c.startdate<>'','Face 2 Face','ONLINE') as 'Training Type', crs.fullname as 'Training Name', IF(ce.completetime>0,FROM_UNIXTIME(ce.completetime),'In Progress') as completed FROM prefix_local_elisprogram_cls_enrol ce join prefix_local_elisprogram_cls_mdl cm on ce.classid = cm.classid join prefix_local_elisprogram_cls c on ce.classid = c.id join prefix_course crs on cm.moodlecourseid = crs.id join prefix_local_elisprogram_usr_mdl um on ce.userid = um.cuserid join prefix_user u on um.muserid = u.id where u.id like %%USERID%% %%FILTER_STARTTIME:ce.completetime:>%% %%FILTER_ENDTIME:ce.completetime:<%% UNION SELECT CONCAT(u.firstname, ' ', u.lastname) as 'Name', 'Personal Learning Event' as 'Training Type', lo.title as 'Training Name', IF(lo.enddate>0,FROM_UNIXTIME(lo.enddate), 'In Progress') as completed FROM prefix_learning_objective lo JOIN prefix_user u on lo.userid=u.id where u.id like %%USERID%% %%FILTER_STARTTIME:lo.enddate:>%% %%FILTER_ENDTIME:lo.enddate:<%% UNION SELECT CONCAT(u.firstname, ' ', u.lastname) as 'Name', 'Program' as 'Training Type', pgm.name as 'Training Name', IF(pa.timecompleted>0,FROM_UNIXTIME(pa.timecompleted), 'In Progress') as completed FROM prefix_local_elisprogram_pgm_assign pa JOIN prefix_local_elisprogram_pgm pgm on pa.curriculumid = pgm.id JOIN prefix_local_elisprogram_usr_mdl um on pa.userid=um.cuserid JOIN prefix_user u on um.muserid=u.id where u.id like %%USERID%% AND pa.completed=2 %%FILTER_STARTTIME:pa.timecompleted:>%% %%FILTER_ENDTIME:pa.timecompleted:<%%

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple timedate filters on union query
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Tim, Replace the following code: Path:- blocks\configurable_reports\components\filters\startendtime From:- if (preg_match("/%%FILTER_STARTTIME [^%]+)%%/i", $finalelements, $output)) { list($field, $operator) = preg_split('/:/', $output[1]); if (!in_array($operator, $operators)) { print_error('nosuchoperator'); } $replace = ' AND '.$field.' '.$operator.' '.$filterstarttime; $finalelements = str_replace('%%FILTER_STARTTIME:'.$output[1].'%%', $replace, $finalelements); } if (preg_match("/%%FILTER_ENDTIME [^%]+)%%/i", $finalelements, $output)) { list($field, $operator) = preg_split('/:/', $output[1]); if (!in_array($operator, $operators)) { print_error('nosuchoperator'); } $replace = ' AND '.$field.' '.$operator.' '.$filterendtime; $finalelements = str_replace('%%FILTER_ENDTIME:'.$output[1].'%%', $replace, $finalelements); } To :- if (preg_match_all("/%%FILTER_STARTTIME [^%]+)%%/i", $finalelements, $output)) { foreach($output[1] as $outputs){ list($field, $operator) = preg_split('/:/', $outputs); if (!in_array($operator, $operators)) { print_error('nosuchoperator'); } $replace = ' AND '.$field.' '.$operator.' '.$filterstarttime; $finalelements = str_replace('%%FILTER_STARTTIME:'.$outputs.'%%', $replace, $finalelements); } } if (preg_match_all("/%%FILTER_ENDTIME [^%]+)%%/i", $finalelements, $output)) { foreach($output[1] as $outputs){ list($field, $operator) = preg_split('/:/', $outputs); if (!in_array($operator, $operators)) { print_error('nosuchoperator'); } $replace = ' AND '.$field.' '.$operator.' '.$filterendtime; $finalelements = str_replace('%%FILTER_ENDTIME:'.$outputs.'%%', $replace, $finalelements); } }

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Multiple timedate filters on union query
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you very much for sharing.  Hopefully it will help someone else because unfortunately, I already paid someone to fix it. Thanks anyway!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Report: List of students in each course
ResponsesInList.Text: This is the code I use to create a list of students and in which course they are. SELECT DISTINCT u.id, u.username as gebruikersnaam, u.firstname as voornaam, u.lastname as achternaam, u.email as email, course_cat.name as category, c.fullname as course, FROM_UNIXTIME(firstaccess, '%d-%m-%Y') as eerstelogin, FROM_UNIXTIME(lastaccess, '%d-%m-%Y') as laatstelogin FROM {user} as u inner JOIN {user_enrolments} as e on e.userid = u.id inner JOIN {enrol} as en on en.id = e.enrolid inner JOIN {course} as c on c.id = en.courseid inner JOIN {course_categories} as course_cat on course_cat.id = c.category where u.deleted = 0 and u.suspended = 0 %%FILTER_COURSES:c.id%%

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: 500 internal error
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Abu A 500 Internal Server Error on your own website requires a completely different course of action. As I mentioned above, most 500 errors are server-side errors, meaning it's likely your problem to fix if it's your website. There are lots of reasons why your site might be serving a 500 Error to your users, but two are most common: A Permissions Error. In most cases, a 500 Internal Server Error is due to an incorrect permission on one or more files or folders. In most of those cases, an incorrect permission on a PHP and CGI script is to blame. These should usually be set at 0775 (-rwxr-xr-x). A PHP Timeout. If your script connects to external resources and those resources timeout, an HTTP 500 error can occur. Timeout rules, or better error handling in your script, should help if this is the cause of the 500 error. A Coding Error in .htaccess. While not as common, be sure to check that your site's .htaccess file is properly structured. If you're running WordPress , Joomla , or another content management or CMS system, be sure to search their support centers for more specific help troubleshooting a 500 Internal Server Error. If you're not using an off-the-shelf content management tool, your web hosting provider , like InMotion , Dreamhost , Bluehost , 1&1 , etc., probably has some 500 Error help that might be more specific to your situation.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: query on a databse activity
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Nicola Please try this query. 
```text
SELECT S.Sname
FROM Students AS S INNER JOIN Enrollment AS E ON S.Sno = E.Sno
GROUP BY S.Sno, S.Sname 
HAVING COUNT(*) = (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Courses)
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Help using User Field Filter in a custom SQL query
ResponsesInList.Text: Ive hunted through the topics and seen similar questions, but cant seem to get a solution. I have a custom SQL report that uses a custom DB view ive created. I need to be able to filter the results by fields that are custom user fields. my view returns these fields as part of its result set. I can get it working with a SEARCHTEXT filter, but I need to use the User Field dropdown. Here is the SQL that works with the SEARCHTEXT filter: select userid, zipcode, county, district from user_all_q_Answers where 1=1 %%FILTER_SEARCHTEXT:district:~%% How would I do this with a User Field dropdown set to the "district" custom field?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help using User Field Filter in a custom SQL query
ResponsesInList.Text: I hope you were able to figure it out on your own and not still waiting on someone to reply here. I actually just figured this out from trial and error and various tips elsewhere.  So in case anyone else is looking for this solution in the future.  The below uses a "user field filter" to find users based on their city. SELECT * FROM {user} u WHERE 1=1 %%FILTER_USERS:u.city%%

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help using User Field Filter in a custom SQL query
ResponsesInList.Text: Travis, I don't think that that will work with a custom view, since the user filter is looking at the standard user table fields only. Have you tried something like: %%FILTER_USERS:user_all_q_Answers.district%% ? I doubt it will work, but it it did, that would be the type of syntax you would need. If not, you can skip the custom view and just use or add the filter directly to the custom profile fields from the original user table. See code I put here showing how to set up: https://docs.moodle.org/32/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#Get_custom_User_profile_fields_for_a_user

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help using User Field Filter in a custom SQL query
ResponsesInList.Text: By the way, this does work with views. So my suggested syntax fix above is correct. Example: Create a view mdl_user_fullname with two columns, the user id as id and a concat of the first and last names into a single column as fullname. Then: SELECT u.username, fn.fullname FROM prefix_user_fullname fn JOIN prefix_user u ON u.id = fn.id %%FILTER_SEARCHTEXT:fn.fullname:~%% works as expected. (Assuming your view has the same prefix_  as your standard tables.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help using User Field Filter in a custom SQL query
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello all I use the configurable report block to make querys also in external database . Exemplo : database name: sgeead2 table name: escolas field to search : razaosocial ex query: SELECT * from sgeead2.`escolas` WHERE 1=1 %%FILTER_SEARCHTEXT:razaosocial:~%% obs: is ver important :   WHERE 1=1 in this case because code have : ( moodle-block_configurablereports / components / filters / searchtext / plugin.class.php ) if ($operator == '~') { $replace = " AND ".$field." LIKE '%".$filter_searchtext."%'"; } id you dont put : WHERE 1=1 Will acknowledge an error SELECT * from sgeead2.`escolas` AND razaosocial LIKE'%filter%'; and corret is: SELECT * from sgeead2.`escolas` WHERE 1=1 AND razaosocial LIKE'%filter%';

ResponsesInList.Title: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a block I've developed in my spare time (since one year ago). This post is a call for volunteers. I need volunteers for testing the block before release a first version in the plugins database . This block is a Moodle custom reports builder. It is designed in a modular way to allow developers to create new plugins in less than an hour. What type of reports can I create? - Courses reports, with information regarding courses. - Users reports, with information regarding users and their activity in a course. - Custom SQL Reports, custom SQL queries. This block can use the same SQL queries that Tim Hunt's Custom SQL queries plugin. Note for developers: You can create your own type of reports. Who can view the reports? When you create a report you can select which users can view it. Links to reports are displayed in a block in the course or site frontpage. Download : http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-2386 (It is the first attachement) Documentation: http://docs.moodle.org/en/blocks/custom_reports/ Feedback and new plugins requests are welcome. Screenshots: http://docs.moodle.org/en/images_en/thumb/4/4c/block_custom_reports_sample_user_report.png/600px-block_custom_reports_sample_user_report.png http://docs.moodle.org/en/images_en/thumb/1/1c/block_custom_reports_sample_sql_report.png/600px-block_custom_reports_sample_sql_report.png

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Custom Filter
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Guys As far as i'm aware this report module was shipped with two filters only. 'Courses' and 'Start/End time'. For people who are looking to add or need Custom Filters in their reports you will have to write PHP code and write your own filter. So there is no easy workaround. I have managed to add a custom filter but had to edit a couple of files in order to get it working. My custom filter was a 'userid' filter as I needed user specific data. Great Module I must say. Thanks Juan.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joe, is very easy: - Create a "courses report" called "My courses final grades" - Add two columns: Course name, final grade for current user So at this point you have a report that shows for the current user the final grades. Now we have to create a User report for displaying all the users in the platform and link this report to the previous ones. - Create a user report called "All users final grades" - Add a column for the username or several columns for firstname, lastname, etc.. - Add a "other report column" column, select the  "May courses final grades" report and the course name column, repeat the same for the final grade report That's all, easy when you understand how it works but the point is that not easy undersantd it

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports

Hi Martin, try: SELECT c.id as "Course Id",

c.fullname as "Course Name"

FROM prefix_cource c WHERE 1

%%FILTER_COURSES:c.id%% This also should work SELECT c.id as "Course Id",

c.fullname as "Course Name"

FROM prefix_cource c WHERE 1=1

%%FILTER_COURSES:c.id%% Anyway, I suggest you to turn on Debugger mode in Moodle and display erros in the browser, so if the SQL query is not correct a message error will be displayed

Regards

Hi , I don't understand very well your question. You are asking how to add conditions in a SQL report but you are pasting a piece of code that users a FILTER The SQL code for get all the rows starting with alphabet P is:

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hola a Todos, Quiero ejecutar este query en informeSQL y me sale error en base de datos. Les dejo el query para que lo prueben y me avisen si el módulo no soporta este query: 
```text
SELECT DATE_FORMAT( FROM_UNIXTIME( fp.modified ) , '%Y/%m/%d' ) AS date, 


(SELECT


count(fp.userid)


FROM  prefix_forum_posts fp,


	  prefix_role_assignments AS ra,


	  prefix_context AS ctx,


	  prefix_course c,


	  prefix_forum_discussions AS fd


WHERE 


      ra.contextid = ctx.id AND


      ra.roleid = 5 AND


	  c.id = 199 AND


	  ctx.instanceid = c.id AND


	  fd.course = c.id AND


	  fp.userid=ra.userid and


	  fd.course = ctx.instanceid and


	  fd.id = fp.discussion and


      DATE_FORMAT( FROM_UNIXTIME( fp.modified ) , '%Y/%m/%d' ) = date) as studentParticipation,


(SELECT


count(fp.userid)


FROM  prefix_forum_posts fp,


	  prefix_role_assignments AS ra,


	  prefix_context AS ctx,


	  prefix_course c,


	  prefix_forum_discussions AS fd


WHERE  


	 ra.contextid = ctx.id AND


     ra.roleid in (3,4) AND


	 c.id = 199 AND


	 ctx.instanceid = c.id  AND


	 fd.course = c.id AND


	 fp.userid=ra.userid and


	 fd.course = ctx.instanceid and


	 fd.id = fp.discussion and


         DATE_FORMAT( FROM_UNIXTIME( fp.modified ) , '%Y/%m/%d' ) = date) as teacherParticipation


FROM prefix_forum_posts fp,


WHERE fp.discussion in 


	(select fd.id 


	 from prefix_forum_discussions fd 


	 where fd.course = 199) 


group by date
```
 Es sobre participación de alumnos y profesores en los foros. Además, he agregado un nuevo tipo de gráfico. Va a salir tal como este: http://pchart.sourceforge.net/documentation.php?topic=advexemple26 De antemano muchas gracias, mientras yo sigo invetigando y cambiando, si es que puedo, código. Que buen módulo me ha ahorrado mucho trabajo Saludos,

ResponsesInList.Text:
Ya lo resolví, habia dejado una coma en el último where 
```text
FROM prefix_forum_posts fp,
```
 
```text

```
 
```text
Así quedaría el query
```
 
```text
SELECT DATE_FORMAT( FROM_UNIXTIME( fp.modified ) , '%Y/%m/%d' ) AS date, 


(SELECT


count(fp.userid)


FROM  prefix_forum_posts fp,


	  prefix_role_assignments AS ra,


	  prefix_context AS ctx,


	  prefix_course c,


	  prefix_forum_discussions AS fd


WHERE 


      ra.contextid = ctx.id AND


      ra.roleid = 5 AND


	  c.id = 199 AND


	  ctx.instanceid = c.id AND


	  fd.course = c.id AND


	  fp.userid=ra.userid and


	  fd.course = ctx.instanceid and


	  fd.id = fp.discussion and


      DATE_FORMAT( FROM_UNIXTIME( fp.modified ) , '%Y/%m/%d' ) = date) as studentParticipation,


(SELECT


count(fp.userid)


FROM  prefix_forum_posts fp,


	  prefix_role_assignments AS ra,


	  prefix_context AS ctx,


	  prefix_course c,


	  prefix_forum_discussions AS fd


WHERE  


	 ra.contextid = ctx.id AND


     ra.roleid in (3,4) AND


	 c.id = 199 AND


	 ctx.instanceid = c.id  AND


	 fd.course = c.id AND


	 fp.userid=ra.userid and


	 fd.course = ctx.instanceid and


	 fd.id = fp.discussion and


         DATE_FORMAT( FROM_UNIXTIME( fp.modified ) , '%Y/%m/%d' ) = date) as teacherParticipation


FROM prefix_forum_posts fp


WHERE fp.discussion in 


	(select fd.id 


	 from prefix_forum_discussions fd 


	 where fd.course = 199) 


%%FILTER_STARTTIME:fp.modified:>%% %%FILTER_ENDTIME:fp.modified:<%% 


group by date
```
 
```text

```

Note - the link to documentation in the first post is now outdated and should be changed. I have successfully created a sql report to show the last course access date by each enrolled student in a given course. At the Site level, I can use a course filter so I can see the results for one course. However, at the Course level, I still need to use the course filter and manually choose the course to restrict the results to that course. Is there a token to restrict SQL report results to the current course context ? My code is below: 
```text
SELECT c.shortname AS CourseID, 


concat(u.lastname,', ',u.firstname ) AS Username, 


u.email AS email, 


( SELECT FROM_UNIXTIME(max(time)) FROM prefix_log as l WHERE course = c.id AND l.userid = u.id) AS LastActivity


FROM prefix_course AS c


JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid


JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id


JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = ra.userid


WHERE ra.roleid =5


AND ctx.instanceid = c.id
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports

It's only for parts that I've used. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Need help! I have no SQL programming experience, and am trying to set up a customizable report.  I need to return only those records where the grade > 7.9.  I also need to add two custom user fields:  County and State.  I'm attaching a file with my code.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Deb, For the grade,  add the line "AND gg.finalgrade>7.9" to the end of the JOIN of the grade. To add the custom user fields, you need to find out what fieldid moodle assigned the custom field to. This is held in the table mdl_user_info_field. Once you have that, you can use the following code: JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS aa ON u.ID = aa.userid AND aa.fieldid=9 In this example, aa.data will contain the information for custom field 9, which in our case is the Position Description. To pull a second field, use JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS ab ON u.ID = ab.userid AND ab.fieldid=5 And again, ab.data will contain the information. So your code (once we know the correct fieldid's is: SELECT  u.firstname AS 'First' , u.lastname AS 'Last',  aa.data AS 'Country', ab.data AS 'State', CASE WHEN gi.itemtype = 'course' THEN CONCAT(c.fullname, ' - Total') ELSE gi.itemname END AS 'Item Name', ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2) AS Grade, FROM_UNIXTIME(gg.timemodified) AS TIME FROM prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS aa ON u.ID = aa.userid AND aa.fieldid=9 JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS ab ON u.ID = ab.userid AND ab.fieldid=9 JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.userid = u.id AND gg.finalgrade>7.9 JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid JOIN prefix_course_categories AS cc ON cc.id = c.category WHERE  gi.courseid = c.id ORDER BY lastname Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hi Andrew, Funny, I saw the aa.data or ab.data and thought that is my coding.... Then I spotted my post further up... I suspect you are hitting your 5000 limit with the merges etc. Try moving JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.userid = u.id AND
gg.finalgrade>10 and gg.finalgrade<100 JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid JOIN prefix_course_categories AS cc ON cc.id = c.category to above the JOIN prefix_user_info_data AS aa ON u.ID = aa.userid AND aa.fieldid=1 and move the WHERE gi.courseid=c.id to JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid AND gi.courseid=c.id This will filter at the join stage, rather than bring it all in and then get rid of unnecessary lines. If you still end up with duplicates, which is possible, dry using a SELECT DISTINCT instead of SELECT. Hope this helps. Cheers Peter

ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello, Thank you for your plugin, it's very useful and works great.  I use it like this. 
```text
SELECT g.name AS groupname, c.shortname AS coursename, mu.username, CONCAT(mu.lastname, ', ',mu.firstname) AS fullname, gg.finalgrade AS finalgrade 
FROM prefix_grade_items AS gi 
INNER JOIN prefix_course c ON c.id = gi.courseid 
LEFT JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.itemid = gi.id 
INNER JOIN prefix_user AS mu ON gg.userid = mu.id 
LEFT JOIN prefix_groups_members AS gm ON mu.id = gm.userid 
LEFT JOIN prefix_groups AS g ON gm.groupid = g.id 
WHERE gi.itemtype = 'course' 
%%FILTER_COURSES:l.course%% 
ORDER BY g.id desc
```
 I wanted to add a filter for the groups if possible, can you help me? I want it to be filtered so that they can choose to view the overall grades of students that are in this group only etc. Thank you,

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello, I have improved my SQL and did this instead. 
```text
SELECT
	groups.name AS "Group",
	users.username, 
	CONCAT(users.lAStname, ', ',users.firstname) AS "Full Name",
	courses.fullname AS "Course Name",
	ROUND(grades.finalgrade, 2) AS "Total Grade",
	CASE 
		WHEN grades.finalgrade > 90 THEN 'Excellent'
		WHEN grades.finalgrade > 70 THEN 'PASsed'
		WHEN grades.finalgrade > 0  THEN 'Failed'
		WHEN grades.finalgrade = 0  THEN 'Incomplete'
     ELSE 'N/A'
	END AS "Remarks"
FROM prefix_user AS users
INNER JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS grades ON grades.userid = users.id
LEFT OUTER JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gradeitems ON grades.itemid = gradeitems.id AND gradeitems.itemtype = 'course'
INNER JOIN prefix_course AS courses ON courses.id = gradeitems.courseid
LEFT OUTER JOIN prefix_groups_members AS groupmembers ON users.id = groupmembers.userid
LEFT OUTER JOIN prefix_groups AS groups ON groupmembers.groupid = groups.id AND courses.id = groups.courseid
WHERE 1=1
%%FILTER_COURSES:courses.id%%
%%FILTER_SEARCHTEXT:groups.name:~%%
ORDER BY groups.name, courses.sortorder, users.lAStname ASC
```
 Right now, I can filter by group by using the search text filter. The drawback is you have to know the name of the group. I hope that there is a group filter instead. Any improvement is welcome/ Thank you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Global report isn't shown in any other course
ResponsesInList.Text:
I encountered the exact same problem. After a debug session, this behavior comes from the following line in  blocks/configurable_reports/block_configurable_reports.php' at line 113 : 
```text
        // Site (Shared) reports.
```
 
```text
        if (!empty($this->config->displayglobalreports)) {
```
 What's happened? When we had a new configurable report block, the `config` property used in the if statement above is NULL so the condition is not met and the global reports are not displayed How to display global reports? Simply, edit our block instance settings by clicking on "Configure Configurable Block". Then save the page with default settings (Display global reports is set to true by default). When you go back to your block instance you will see the global reports! By editing the block settings,  the `config` property is created and the option are saved, the condition in the if statement are met, so the code displays global reports. Greetings, ben
