SELECT u.firstname AS 'Firstname', u.lastname AS 'Lastname', c.shortname AS Course, ROUND( gg.finalgrade, 0 ) AS 'Final grade' FROM prefix_course c JOIN prefix_context ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_role_assignments ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id JOIN prefix_user u ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN prefix_grade_grades gg ON gg.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_grade_items gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid JOIN prefix_course_categories cc ON cc.id = c.category WHERE gi.courseid = c.id AND gi.itemtype = 'course' ANd u.deleted = 0 ORDER BY gg.finalgrade DESC

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL Help
ResponsesInList.Text: EDIT: The news is not as good as I'd hoped. See next post for why. Good news! The filtering you want to do doesn't actually require any SQL! If you've got a query that gives you what you want for all users, just do the following: Create a report with the query that gets the information you want for all users Click on Conditions Select Current User from the Add: dropdown Type c1 in the Condition box Click Update That should be it!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL Help
ResponsesInList.Text: Argh. Well, I take it back. It looks like you can't create conditions like that on a custom SQL report. In that case, unless someone knows a way to insert the current user into the SQL statement I'm not sure what you want to do is actually possible. If you can insert variables like that into the query, though, I'd love to know about it! Can anyone confirm/deny for sure?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL Help
ResponsesInList.Text:
A HA! I'm glad you asked this question, because it finally got me off my but and digging through the code enough to answer this question. Turns out you can use '%%USERID%%' to refer to the current user's ID, so if you change your query like so... 
```text
SELECT u.firstname AS 'Firstname', u.lastname AS 'Lastname', c.shortname AS Course, ROUND( gg.finalgrade, 0 ) AS 'Final grade'


FROM prefix_course c
```
 then it will be limited to the current user. HOWEVER... I don't think this is actually the query you want. This just gets the users' individual grades. Gimme a sec and I'll try to come up with something more like what I think you want...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL Help
ResponsesInList.Text:
See if this is closer to what you want. I am assuming that you are using the course completion feature ( http://docs.moodle.org/24/en/Course_completion ). I don't actually have any students who have completed anything yet, so I can only test so far, but it should get you started, at least. 
```text
select 
	u.firstname, 
	u.lastname, 
	cr.fullname, 
	from_unixtime(cm.timecompleted) 
from  
	prefix_user u 
	join prefix_user_enrolments eu on u.id = eu.userid 
	join prefix_enrol ec on eu.enrolid = ec.id 
	join prefix_course cr on cr.id = ec.courseid 
	join prefix_course_completions cm on cr.id = cm.course and u.id = cm.userid 
where 
	cm.timecompleted is not NULL
	and u.id = %%USERID%%
order by
	cm.timecompleted
```
 Good luck!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: SQL Help
ResponsesInList.Text: Brad, You rock!!  The code above worked, but it wouldn't pull any records.  However, the previous post by adding the and u.id = %%USERID%% worked like a dream (just without the completed date).  I never thought to use the and statement. I'm rolling with that one without the completed dates for now. Thanks so much for all your help!! Fred

ResponsesInList.Title: Query to count course logins
ResponsesInList.Text: I need to approximate how many times a student has "logged in" to a particular course. Since students don't truly "log in" to a course, they only login to the entire Moodle system, I need to write a SQL query that will approximate the "course logins" for me. One approach that comes to mind would be to count the number of times a student has entered a course starting from a page not within that same course. In other words, when a student views a main course page by navigating from a different course or from the MyMoodle page. I can count the number of times a student has viewed a main course page by writing something like SELECT COUNT(log.id) AS 'Session Count', c.fullname AS 'Course', u.lastname AS 'User' FROM prefix_log AS log JOIN prefix_course AS c ON c.id=log.course JOIN prefix_enrol AS e ON e.courseid=c.id JOIN prefix_user_enrolments AS ue ON ue.enrolid=e.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id=ue.userid WHERE log.action='view' AND log.module='course' AND log.userid=u.id GROUP BY u.lastname but that includes all the times a student has returned to the main course page from an activity in the same course. Does anyone have any idea how I can specify that the original link to the course has to come from outside the course itself? I hope I've been clear enough. I'll be happy to clarify anything.

ResponsesInList.Title: SQL Query Help Selecting Custom User Fields
ResponsesInList.Text: I would love some help on writing a custom SQL query to return the date completed, the course, the user's state and the user's role. The custom user fields are located in the mdl_user_info_data table. Get the state you would SELECT data FROM mdl_user_info_data WHERE fieldid = 1 Get the role you would SELECT data FROM mdl_user_info_data WHERE fieldid = 2 SELECT cc.timecompleted AS datecompleted, cc.course AS id, cc.userid AS user, c.id AS courseid, c.shortname AS course, u.userid AS userinfoid, (u.data FROM u WHERE u.fieldid = 1) AS state, (u.data FROM u WHERE u.fieldid = 2) AS role FROM mdl_course_completions cc JOIN  mdl_course c ON (cc.course = c.id) JOIN mdl_user_info_data u ON (cc.userid = u.userid) WHERE cc.timecompleted >= 0 Any help would be greatly appriciated. Thanks, Steven

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 2.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello - I am trying to add this new module to my test Moodle 2.2. We are using Oracle as our Database . When trying to install the Config Reports Block, I get the following Error: block_configurable_reports DDL sql execution error More information about this error Debug info: ORA-00972: identifier is too long CREATE TABLE m_block_configurable_reports_report ( id NUMBER(10) NOT NULL , courseid NUMBER(11) NOT NULL, ownerid NUMBER(11) NOT NULL, visible NUMBER(4) NOT NULL, name VARCHAR2(128 CHAR) DEFAULT ' ' NOT NULL, summary CLOB, Is this something that should be reported here - or under the Moodle Tracker ? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.2
ResponsesInList.Text: This is because the table name " m_block_configurable_reports_report" is too long for oracle (max 30 chars) I didn't know it http://stackoverflow.com/questions/756558/what-is-the-maximum-length-of-a-table-name-in-oracle This is a BIG issue, is there any posibility to change this in Oracle using a global setting? I'm so sorry, I'm rewritting the plugin for making it a new admin report plugin for Moodle 2.2 so I will change these Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you for considering this. I am a user - not a database person. Regards.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.2
ResponsesInList.Text: That is a hard limit in Oracle, and therefore the coding guidelines say that all table names must be at most 28 characters long (without the prefix). The XMLDB editor enforces this, so you should not have been able to create a table name that long in the first place.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Originally this block was called "Custom reports" and the table has this name: pref_custom_reports_report (less than 30) After upgrading to the contrib are, I was suggested to change the name for avoiding confusion with the plugin custom sql reports, I change also the prefix for adding the _block_ to follow the frankenstyle names So I change this using a bulk replace in files, this what has happened It was a bad idea

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Install Fails on 2.3
ResponsesInList.Text: Version 2.3 of Moodle is beta software, According to the download link it is " Only for testing and development".  If you are a developer you might experiment with editing the access.php file.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Install Fails on 2.3
ResponsesInList.Text: The file db\access.php still references the admin role which has been renamed to manager (hence the error).  It should still install fine (though I haven't tried 2.3 yet and it might be more picky than 2.2). You can change 'admin' => CAP_ALLOW to 'manager' => CAP_ALLOW in db\access.php (4 times) to fix it. This should be changed in an updated version of the block. -- Scott

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Install Fails on 2.3

(I am using Moodle 1.9.6 Is the Configurable Reports Block the easiest way of doing this? Is this block the best way of generating SQL reports? ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How can I generate a list of user names and email addresses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Peter, In Moodle 1.9, log on as Admin and go to: Site Administration > Users > Accounts > Bulk user actions > Show advanced > Course role Enter the short name of the course Click on Add Filter Then Add all With selected users, choose: Download Go Choose your format Continue And you'll be able to save the list of participants in the course as, for example, an Excel file which you can then edit as you wish. Cheers, Glenys

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How can I generate a list of user names and email addresses
ResponsesInList.Text: GFlenys, Works as you described ... thanks. Peter Evans

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: GRADES SQL: Trouble with extracting grades! Any help appreciated
ResponsesInList.Text: This may not be of any help, but I remember looking at the tables to figure out why every time I changed the grading method of the gradebook (from average to highest, or highest to median, etc), uploaded grades disappeared and only grades produced as the result of a SCORM attempt stayed in the gradebook. I noticed there was nothing in the "rawgrade" column of the table for uploaded grades... they only appeared in the "finalgrade."  When I changed the grading method, it seemed to remove anything that was in final grade and replace it with whatever was in rawgrade. Maybe gg.rawgrade > 0 is keeping your uploaded grades from showing, as an uploaded grade of "100" would show "0" in gg.rawgrade, but "100" in gg.finalgrade -Mark

ResponsesInList.Title: FTP report
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi all, Is it possible for a report we have running using this block to be sent via FTP as a XLS, csv file to a local server . Or run the report and save it locally on the server as a csv XLS file? Thanks, Matt

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: FTP report
ResponsesInList.Text: Here's how we do something similar. I'm using Windows with IIS and MySQL database . The default prefix we use is "mdl_". 1. On the server should be a folder "C:\Program Files\My SQL \MySQL Server 5.5\bin" 2. Take the SQL commands you have written and copy-and-paste them to a text file in this folder called 'XPORT.SQL' (make sure to change "prefix_" to "mdl_" in the file) 3. Create a batch file in that folder called 'XPORT.BAT' with the following command: mysql.exe -- host =HOSTNAME --user=USERNAME --password=PASSWORD --database=moodle19 < XPORT.SQL > OUTPUT.DAT Where: HOSTNAME is the servername (or could be 'localhost') USERNAME is the name of the user of the database PASSWORD is the password of the above-named user moodle19 is the name of the database (yours could be different) XPORT.SQL is the file you created above with your SQL commands OUTPUT.DAT is the TAB-DELIMITED file to be created (it will still open in Excel) 4. Execute XPORT.BAT at the command line. This will create OUTPUT.DAT 5. Once you have the OUTPUT.DAT created you can create an FTP command file. It will have the commands needed to send the file to the recipient. You only need to create this file once. It should look something like this: OPEN ftp.whatever.com USER username PASS password HASH BINARY SEND OUTPUT.DAT (other commands necessary) CLOSE BYE Where: OPEN <site> - makes the connection to the recipients server USER <username> - the username they probably gave you to login PASS <password> - the password for the account HASH - will show "#" characters as each block is sent (this line is optional) BINARY - indicates to the recipients FTP server that the file you are sending is binary SEND <filename> - this command tells the receiving FTP server that you are sending a file (use GET if this is a file you are getting from them) CLOSE - disconnectes from the remote server BYE - quits the local FTP program 6. You then execute this file by using the following command at the command line: FTP -S:XPORT.TXT This can be added to the end of the XPORT.BAT file, if you like. I'm unsure of your general skill level so if you have problems with any of this, let me know.

ResponsesInList.Title: Can Configurable Reports do this?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi. Currently (under Moodle 1.9) we use a custom script to generate a report as shown below: This allows us to view each category of courses and monitor student use in each individual course over a 10-day period. As we move to Moodle 2.2, this script will unfortunately have to be retired, and so we're looking for alternative reporting tools. Consequently, my question is: can Configurable Reports generate something similar and, if so, how? I've experimented quickly and the nearest I can get is a course report with the following columns: c1 - course field; fullname c2 - no. of users with role...; student c3 - course stats; active (last week) enrolments c4 - no. of users with role...; teacher This is similar to what we need, but not really accurate in terms of column 3, since it includes *all* enrolled users - both students and teachers - and, additionally, we really do need the names of the course tutors listed in column 4. Any help with this would be very much appreciated.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can Configurable Reports do this?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Roland, sorry but no, there is no columns for displaying the tutors name or accurate data for c3 (only students) You will have to develop your custom columns, you can duplicate an existing one and add the missing features Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Changing the module type, and refactoring and rewriting some parts of the code
ResponsesInList.Text: This is a quick note about the future of the plugin. I'm rewritting and refactoring some parts of the code, this is why: - Since Moodle 2.2 there is a new type of plugin called "report" that integrates very well in the curren Moodle course and user navigation. So I'm going to change from a block to this new type of plugin - I'm cleaning and refactoring some parts of the code in order to follow the Moodle codelines style guide. My objective is a 100% compliant code - There is a big issue that prevents this plugin to work with Oracle , it will be solved - I'm adding new types of columns and reports (cohorts, rubrics) - Moodle 2.3 will include (hopefully) support for multi-tenancy (multi sites), so I wan be sure that this plugin will be able to work cross-site for building reports with aggregated data I will commit in my github account the new development version in a few days

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Displaying course Dedication time in hours
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Vinit, unfortunatelly you can configure it, you can change the source code: this file: https://github.com/jleyva/moodle-block_configurablereports/blob/MOODLE_21_STABLE/components/columns/userstats/plugin.class.php Look for the format_time function, if you change this line with: return $totaldedication/3600 ; you will get the dedication in hours

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Displaying course Dedication time in hours
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Juan, I mean to say, instead of 1 day, 20 hours it shold display 44 hours. So I made new function in moodlelib.php function format_hours_time($totalsecs){ $totalsecs = abs($totalsecs); $hours     = floor($totalsecs/HOURSECS); $remainder = $totalsecs - ($hours*HOURSECS); $mins      = floor($remainder/MINSECS); $secs      = $remainder - ($mins*MINSECS); $ss = ($secs == 1)  ? 'Second'  : 'Seconds'; $sm = ($mins == 1)  ? 'Minute'  : 'Minutes'; $sh = ($hours == 1) ? 'Hour' : 'Hours'; $ohours = ''; And called this function. Thank you very much. Vinit

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: I managed to resolve this. I created a new filter called users. This must be uploaded in to the configurable_reports\components\filters\users folder. It also does a sort on the usernames before giving the list to the user. Any improvements on this will appreciated. The SQL statement is SELECT u.username As EmpNo, u.firstname AS 'Name' , u.lastname AS 'Surname',cc.name AS 'Category', c.fullname AS 'Course', gi.itemname AS 'Item Name', ROUND(gg.finalgrade,2) AS Score,ROUND(gg.rawgrademax,2) AS Max, ROUND(gg.finalgrade / gg.rawgrademax * 100 ,2) as '%', if (ROUND(gg.finalgrade / gg.rawgrademax * 100 ,2) > 79,'Yes' , 'No') as Pass FROM prefix_course AS c JOIN prefix_context AS ctx ON c.id = ctx.instanceid JOIN prefix_role_assignments AS ra ON ra.contextid = ctx.id JOIN prefix_user AS u ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN prefix_grade_grades AS gg ON gg.userid = u.id JOIN prefix_grade_items AS gi ON gi.id = gg.itemid JOIN prefix_course_categories AS cc ON cc.id = c.category WHERE  gi.courseid = c.id and gi.itemname != 'Attendance' and u.username != '' %%FILTER_USERS:u.id%% ORDER BY `Name` ASC

ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joe, reviewing your report what I can see is that the filter doesn't work as you expected. Actually, the filter applies over the data of each column in a row (do not filter rows) I.e: If you add a course stats column, the data of this column will be filtered according your selected dates in the filter. So you will see stats for a range date I think you were experting to filter courses based on the creation time of the course or something similar. What this plugin does is filter the data of a column Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Create a new filter in my sql query
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan Leyva 1. Start and End date filters aren't working in SQL Report.  Could you please   give an example like how to write an sql query exactly? 2. I need to create a new filter in my sql query. How this works? Please help me

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, you can find a example here: http://docs.moodle.org/en/blocks/configurable_reports/#Creating_a_SQL_Report For creating new filters you need to program in PHP, take a look to the existing ones in components/filter you will have to modify problaby also the sql report code in reports/sql You need php skills and some Moodle knowledge to understand how it works, it's not complicated Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Juan Leyva, I couldn't get start and end filters work exactly in my sql report type and my course filter is working fine. Here is my sql query. Could you please judge me with the right syntax to get START AND END FILTERS. SELECT c.fullname, c.shortname FROM prefix_course c,prefix_reenroll r WHERE r.courseid=c.id AND 1%%FILTER_COURSES:c.id%% GROUP BY courseid

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text:
The table reenroll needs a field called time to work: SELECT c.fullname, c.shortname FROM prefix_course c,prefix_reenroll r WHERE r.courseid=c.id AND 1%%FILTER_COURSES:c.id%%
%%FILTER_STARTTIME:r.time:>%% %%FILTER_ENDTIME:r.time:<%% GROUP BY courseid

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: In my database the reenroll table has field "enrolleddate" which stores the values in date format as "YYYY-MM-DD". I am unable to get the result using the filter u provided...CAN U PLZ HELP ME OUT...????? Also  if i want to add a new filter of my own,what shall i do..?????

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: The date format must be timestamp, It doesn't work with other formats See previous messages about adding a new filter in this same post Regards

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you juan Now i cannot change my database fields in unix timestamp,Can u provide me any other better alternative....????

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: New plugin: Custom reports
ResponsesInList.Text: Two alternatives Create a new field in the same table with the date in timestamp format. Use a cron job for updating every X minutes the date in timestamp format or modify the components/filters/datetime code of the plugin Regards
